name: places/ChIJMTWH3rtYwokREGTrZuZDa08

displayName.text: RPM Realty NY: Manon Isabelle Harrington

formattedAddress: 317 E 83rd St, New York, NY 10028, USA
adrFormatAddress: 317 E 83rd St, New York, NY 10028, USA

originalText.text: Isabelle is an excellent broker. I met up with her at a property that wasn’t ideal but she went ahead and asked all the right questions then brought me up the street to exactly what I was looking for. Along the way there she pointed out the closest laundry, good restaurants, etc. She will go the extra mile for a serious renter/buyer and is very informative throughout the process as this was my first New York apartment. I can’t say enough positive things about her as she made my move in process seamless. Yes, she is direct as mentioned before but Thats what you need to get things done and this girl means business. Thank you Isabelle!

originalText.text: Like all the other reviews have stated, this lady has a disgusting personality and super rude. Do not ever use her as a broker and her company Rpm must be crazy to employ her as she is a thief as well.

text.text: Like all the other reviews have stated, this lady has a disgusting personality and super rude. Do not ever use her as a broker and her company Rpm must be crazy to employ her as she is a thief as well.

originalText.text: Isabelle can be intense, but that’s Manhattan real estate for you! She’s aggressive and direct and that’s really the attitude needed in NYC’s competitive market. She helped me land a great studio in a beautiful neighborhood within 2 days and I was able to make a good faith deposit to hold the apartment while working things out with guarantors. First time renters who are unfamiliar with the complicated process might not jibe with Isabelle’s style, but in any case it is clear that she truly wants the best for her clients.

text.text: Isabelle can be intense, but that’s Manhattan real estate for you! She’s aggressive and direct and that’s really the attitude needed in NYC’s competitive market. She helped me land a great studio in a beautiful neighborhood within 2 days and I was able to make a good faith deposit to hold the apartment while working things out with guarantors. First time renters who are unfamiliar with the complicated process might not jibe with Isabelle’s style, but in any case it is clear that she truly wants the best for her clients.

originalText.text:
This was an extremely unpleasant experience. We found an amazing apartment and were ready to move forward with it. She wanted a good faith deposit and sent a blank receipt instead of a contract, which meant the information was incomplete. Asked for more specific terms. She said it’s a receipt, and laughed at us because “she can’t sign something saying we gave her money that we didn’t give her.” We said that we could not give her money unless we had a legit contract. She refused to write up a contract. Was incredibly confusing at every turn, interrupted us, and eventually, sent “Lol”s and aggressive, all capital letter text messages at our request for a contract. Then without a word to us, she refunded our application fee. No “this won’t work out,” no straightforward explanations… she was just personally frustrated that we wanted our money protected under explicit terms, and then decided she was done.
I am truly never one to complain about people— I’ve worked in retail for 6 years, and know that at any job, people are under stress. I don’t think this is the case here— it was just very unnecessarily confusing and unprofessional.  I’m writing a review because I want renters to not have to go through such a stressful and unpleasant experience. I would hate for a college student or a new renter with not as thick skin and/or family to help them understand things to have to go through this. I’m still not sure how legit any of this was and am a little worried that she has personal information of mine from our application - especially after writing a negative review. I will likely be following up with her boss if I can even find them.

text.text:

originalText.text: Isabelle was great! Her very reasonable rates (especially compared to everyone else) is what caught my attention first, but she definitely made the whole experience very easy, smooth, and worthwhile. I was approved and am signing for a place - because of her, my move will be easy and only a few  short streets away. She was very responsive, which helps when you are trying to juggle several apartments/buildings in your mind, email inbox, and text messages. If she wasn't as responsive as she was, I probably would have turned my attention to other places - but she was always responding timely, so she kept my attention and it all worked out. She's very friendly as well. She seems very busy, so I can see why some might see it as her not paying attention or being quick, but you have to understand that she, too, is trying to manage a ton of people and units at the same time - I'm pretty sure that all of us have felt the same way at our own jobs, so it definitely never even crossed my mind that she wasn't being attentive. I had an awesome experience with Isabelle. Very friendly. Highly recommended.
